oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Reached for too much!, between 1955 and 1974
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An original political cartoon drawing created by Jack Knox, the Nashville Banner editorial cartoonist from the mid-1940s to early 1970s. This cartoon relates to the educational organization known as the Tennessee Education Association, with headquarters in Nashville, Tennessee. The organization is an affiliate of the National Education Association. In the cartoon, an arm ("T.E.A.") reaches into a jar ("Tenn. Tax Income") and grabs a handful, but cannot pull its hand out through the rim ("Sound Financing"). Below Knox's signature on the cartoon is the inscription, "Apologies to Aesop." Forms part of the Jack Knox Political Cartoon Collection. 1 original cartoon drawing : b & w ; 16.75 x 24 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville Banner; Tennessee Education Association--Caricatures and cartoons
